chunks.title: Mandatory Electronic Filing
chunks.content: Unless otherwise permitted by these Rules or by the Court, all documents required to be filed with the Court in civil and criminal cases must be filed electronically using the Court's Case Management/Electronic Case Filing system (CM/ECF).

requirements.exceptions: as permitted by Rules or Court

chunks.title: Registration for Electronic Filing
chunks.content: Attorneys admitted to the Bar of this Court and attorneys admitted pro hac vice must register as Filing Users of the Court's CM/ECF system. Registration constitutes consent to receive service by electronic means.

chunks.title: Signatures on Electronic Filings
chunks.content: The user log-in and password required to submit documents to the CM/ECF system serve as the user's signature on all electronic documents filed with the Court. The name of the Filing User must also appear as a signature line, preceded by '/s/'.

chunks.title: Filing Deadline
chunks.content: Filing must be completed before midnight Eastern Time to be considered timely filed that day.

chunks.title: PDF Format Requirements
chunks.content: All electronically filed documents are to be in text-searchable Portable Document Format (PDF). Documents that exist only in paper form may be scanned into PDF format. Scanned documents must be of sufficient quality to be readable.

chunks.title: File Size Limits
chunks.content: The CM/ECF system has file size limits. Documents exceeding the file size limit must be split into multiple files, with each file labeled sequentially.

chunks.title: Hyperlinks
chunks.content: Electronically filed documents may contain hyperlinks to other portions of the same document, to documents previously filed in the case, or to authorities cited in the document.
